TopicTitle: So... Spaceplane Plus is added to the game!

Articles.Content: Congrats, sir. As a rocketeer, I now have interest in spaceplanes. Downloading...

Judging by the released picture, they're about the same size as the old ones (pretty sure that's a stock 1.25m Circular Intake on the nose). Looks like bays suitable for 2.5m are out.

https://31.media.tumblr.com/e819fdab68106cb386b463d84e158d6a/tumblr_inline_nadgl16XYm1rr2wit.jpg

Fingers crossed they upscale Mk3 to hold 2.5m meter parts. Otherwise, there's little point using them over SP+.

Though I always love more parts, I think that the parts menus need an overhaul to make them easier to use. Its getting to the point where you have to scroll through pages and pages to find the right part.

(Yes I know there is a mod I'm talking about in stock)

I'm not thaaat excited. Don't get me wrong, the mod itself is great, it's just not what we really need. We need space craft parts that can be used in the context of other stock parts. Now with that fancy weird crosssection of SP+ that is hardly possible. Ok there might be adapters and stuff, but why don't we get reasonable cockpits, passanger modules, cargo bays etc. with a rockomax sized round crosssection? This is what we need. This is what would be versatile and blend in fantastic with stock KSP. And where are wings that are tanks? Just about any part is a tank that in RL is not a tank and vice versa. RL planes usually have 80-100% fuel only in wings and nowhere else. Of course the IVA alone is worth an addition. So my feelings about that are really mixed.

That's a consequence of how the lift model is implemented. Since mass figures into the lift calculations, burning fuel reduces lift from wings with tanks.

I'll have a slice of humble pie, please.
The functionality of several other mods is also being incorporated - Spaceplane + is just the one they're buying-in.

That's a consequence of how the lift model is implemented. Since mass figures into the lift calculations, burning fuel reduces lift from wings with tanks.

Mass is factored in with drag, not in lift. Otherwise the paperlight wings we have now would have no lift at all.

Edited August 20, 2014 by DocMoriarty

Mass is calculeted in drag, not in lift. Otherwise the paperlight wings we have now would have no lift at all.

Herpy derp, you're right, don't know what I was thinking. Lift remains constant with changing mass, but drag does not. So the lift/drag ratio goes all screwy with mass changing wings.

Thanks for the correction.

When MaxMaps showed that, it almost sounded like he was aware of this issue but was surprised that it didn't look like these parts would fix that. Hopefully that means another pass on the parts.

I've been wanting something like this ever since I started (i'm a new guy, started in .20 or .21 something like that) Now I can finally build decent planes that can hold cargo without actually needing to download a mod, they needed something like this for a while.

Those spaceplanes parts are absolutely gorgeous and I'm glad to see them in game. Time for me to expand my stock only horizon a bit .

I love the new cockpit Hugo made and I wouldn't mind it replacing the current cockpit (though I still want a smooth topped cockpit. Hugos one isn't as streamlined as the current mk3. But you can actually see out of his), but what is the deal with the mk3 line? Is the mk3 size going out of game, or just the old pieces? or what?
